DOC.brief_title: External Nasal Dilator Oxygen Therapy Respiratory Failure
DOC.detailed_description: Acute respiratory failure secondary bronchiolitis one common diagnose child admit pediatric intensive care unit . Objectives : The primary outcome study compare respiratory parameter patient high flow nasal cannula ( HFNC ) HFNC external nasal dilator ( END ) . Methods : This prospective randomized control trial . All child admit Loma Linda University Children 's Hospital July 2015 May 2017 approximately 22 month due acute respiratory failure secondary bronchiolitis eligible inclusion study . Two arm study , one HFNC HFNC ENDS . Modified Bronchiolitis Severity Score use assess respiratory parameter part study . The investigator anticipate use END positive impact respiratory status child acute respiratory failure . Appropriate statistical analysis data occur data de-identified .
